website_summaries.verdict: Great unit for the price. The best deal for a quality clamp meter right now.
pros: Versatile, well built, and has incredibly speedy readings
Display is clear and easy to read
cons: Testing leads are not as insulated as those of more expensive models

customer_reviews.title: Nice Meter But....  Big Void In Load Measurements
customer_reviews.text: I bought this meter to measure the load on several circuits as well as sub panels. Unfortunately, if you have a circuit over 20 amps, it goes into overload.... It will not measure a load above 20 amps or less than 200 amps.... That is a BIG void in my opinion. The description does not clearly state this. The specs state "AC current: 2/20/200/400A ". Maybe a more accurate description would be "2-20 amps OR 200-400 amps".
customer_reviews.author: G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: great value, excellent "beater" meter for job sites you won't cry if you break it
customer_reviews.text: every man should own one of these. no need to buy some crazy expensive meter unless you're an electrical engineer/electrician that reaaaallllyyy needs something like that. otherwise, this will do the trick. i use this to install residential solar on a daily basis. so far, so good. if it breaks or i lose it, well, they're cheap enough to buy again. i'd hate to lose or break a $100+ volt meter. When you're moving fast and trying to get shizz done, sometimes you gotta throw up up to the guys on the roof, or the guys on the ground...this is the guy you wanna be throwing around, not some crazy expensive meter. good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: ThirdEye1701

customer_reviews.title: I like the mode button to change my diode continuity choice ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the mode button to change my diode continuity choice of readout to audible. Works good on low AC current measurements, just what I wanted. Works good on DC voltage measurements, does not require switching from 2 to 20 to 200 to 2000 volts like some meters. In other words if it is .246 volts or 24.6 you get the read out fast and accurate. The peak measurement is something not found on cheap meters. Its not too big or too heavy to use for my bench top or field measurements. I like the AA battery choice for long life, the 9V batteries don't last long in most meters. It is accurate on resistance measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Useless Information

customer_reviews.title: Trust in this company to stand behind their product! BOOM
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome company. Mine arrived with a simple defect. It did not make the product useless but it was simply not perfect. I reached out to the seller and in less then 12 hours had a reply back. They asked a clarifying question, I sent them photos of what I was referencing and within another 8 hours they were sending me a replacement. WOW! Buy with confidence that this seller and company stand behind their products 100%. The job that I needed this for perfect. Exactly what I needed and it worked beautifully! BOOM!
customer_reviews.author: JHolla

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk
customer_reviews.text: It worked for four months. Then nothing, would not turn on after replacing batteries. Into the garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dynarski

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Meter, when turned on, began fluctuating even with contacting electric power. Occasionally would actually read correct, then began immediately jumping all over the place. Changed batteries for new, but no change in operation. Two days later, display will not read anything at all. I'm very disappointed in this meter. It is now totally dead and ready for the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for about a day
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about a day, then started to show a high level of transient voltage without contacting anything, with probes out, nothing near the clamps and the meter not near anything of high voltage. Tested it inside the home, outside the home, near objects, away from objects. The voltage measured at rest is 50mV and 250mV DC. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Design Group

customer_reviews.title: REGISTER FOR EXTENDED WARRANTY! - Lasted 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: This is highly rated, and for good reason - it works well. However, it died after about 18 months after purchase. I left the batteries in (which the manual says not to do) - they didn't leak or anything, but it will no longer power on after replacing with new batteries. I called Etekcity, and they asked if I registered to get the extended warranty (2 years), which I did not. However, I didn't expect it to die so young. Response was, "sorry, thanks for understanding." I guess I'm in the market for another multimeter - I'll probably buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Y.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth even the black Friday sale price
customer_reviews.text: The "clamp" functionality doesn't work. Trying to measure the ac amps for several lamps, rack servers, and a Christmas tree yield a MAX of 0.01 amps. While I knew that was wrong, I compared it head to head with a kill-a-watt meter. This clamp meter represents everything wrong with cheap chinese manufacturing and isn't worth any amount of money saved. For my safety, I'm probably getting a Fluke next time.
customer_reviews.author: Woodrow

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The first unit that arrived was DOA. Or so I thought, turns out it was just the positive test lead that was bad. Etekcity contacted me and I told them that the test lead was bad. They immediately offered to send me a new unit! It was an absolute pleasure dealing with them and service was excellent. The multimeter itself is quite nice and even comes with a carrying case and lanyard. For the price, it is really good and the readings are accurate. Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a cheap (as in price) multimeter that also has a clamp. Keep in mind this is NOT a true RMS meter. But for the price it is great!
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: does not read dc amperage despite pictures that suggest it does
customer_reviews.text: doesn't read dc amperage over the clamps, purchased for exactly that testing high amp starting system of a car/jet ski. misleading marketing photos that show the dc amperage symbol. bought another brands that did have that functionality
customer_reviews.author: advanced user

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it when the symbols on the device do not ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't like it when the symbols on the device do not accurately give an information of the functions, in particular the absence of the AC symbol next to the amps is done as if intentionally, pay attention to the devices of other companies, there is indicated the type of DC or AC next to the switch, here simply 200/400A, this misleads the buyer! Not to mention that in China the absolutely same device (just another brand) costs exactly two times cheaper. I had to return the device and order another, it does not fit, AC only!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, but it's how problems are handled
customer_reviews.text: The one feature that drew me to this specific unit was the loud audio sound on the continuity setting as shown in the video. The disappointment is that the audio sound is actually so low that I need to hold the metre right up to my ear to hear it! Either faulty or misleading, either way I plan to return it. The company reached out to me immediately and made arrangements for the product to be replaced, no questions asked. Within a few days a new multimeter arrived. In business, mistakes happen, it's how a company handles things that make the difference. I am very pleased with how Etekcity handled this issue and would definitely recommend them as a seller.
customer_reviews.author: jim Brown

customer_reviews.title: Used to measure power consumption and estimate costs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased along withto monitor power usage of different electronics around the house. Works well, seems to be accurate. The clamp fits within the splitter's loops and is strong enough to be held their on its own force. Watts = Voltage x Current, so if the ammeter is reading 0.8 amps on a standard US socket, multiply by 120 (can vary from 110v to 120) to get 96 Watts. You can then estimate how much it costs to run by multiplying by your power rate (probably around $0.15 per Kwh) by how long it is running and dividing by 1000. (120 x Meter reading x hours running x Electric Rate)/1000 = Cost to run (roughly).
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: In DC it autoranges to mv.
customer_reviews.text: In DC it autoranges to mv. dumbest thing ever. the meter bounces all over the place. Update the company contacted me to make things right, with whatever it would take. I opted to keep it for the amp meter and found something better for 12v systems. I did not receive any compensation for changing my review. From 3 stars to 4. If there was a button just for milivolts I would give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: I have purchase products before from Elekcity and have been pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable meter at an unbelievable price. I have purchase products before from Elekcity and have been pleased so far. This purchase was no different. Quality seems good. I have had this for over 6 months and it works flawless. I am only a home owner, not a contractor, so I do not use this a lot but when I do it is dependable. May not last but a few year but at this price I can certainly afford a new one.
customer_reviews.author: SEG

customer_reviews.title: Update: Manufacturer makes it right.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to figure out. Not user friendly. No clear instructions. Unstable readings. Update: Following my original review, the manufacturer contacted me to try to help solve my problems with the product Ultimately, the manufacturer is replacing the product, well after the warranty period. They also gave me information that helps me use the product. It would still be an improvement if the various switch positions were simply labelled AC or DC, rather than the symbols they use. Once you learn the symbols, it should be OK.
customer_reviews.author: nickn

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: $4 price rise since purchase last week -1. Alligator clip attachments -1. Vertical hang means -1. Altogether 4.4* is a good rating. Although Ive got to question the occurrence of random LED reading when simply set to DC V, Ohms, Continuity yet no input sensor probes applied. But when an actual reading is sought using probes, the LED readout settles and returns valid values. It would be handy if it included alligator clip attachments. The unit includes a wrist strap attachment at the bottom. If the strap attachment were at the top, it could enable hanging the meter under a vehicle hood while viewing right side up readings.
customer_reviews.author: HeR3tic

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: When I ohm out the leads the numbers Jump up and down the same thing happens when I'm in the DC setting before I even touch the leads to what I want to read volts on.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Good for basic use
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I'm electrician and I wanted something for home just to be safe. It's no substitute for a fluke meter. DO NOT use it for anything above 110 v and even then be very careful. But for checking batteries and basic household continuity it works great. Used it allot doing electrical repairs on an old car. The amp clamp is not very accurate I get readings between 1 and .5 on the same wire just a few seconds apart. But if you are just checking that current is there, it works. I tried using it on circuit boards but it's not sensitive enough to be reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Nimic

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Spend your money elsewhere. This worked for about a month properly before breaking. The readings are constantly fluctuating, even when you have the leads unplugged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used delivered disguised as new.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in damaged box. Instrument was dirty. Leads were plugged into device. Did not have manual in box. Meter was turned onto ohms setting. Basically, the meter appeared to have been taken out of someone's toolbox, placed into a box, and shipped to me. Caveat emptor!
customer_reviews.author: Gunner

customer_reviews.title: the tool does its job
customer_reviews.text: I have similar tools that have cost me 10 times more but they do the same, I liked the precision that it has, the quality of the material is good, it already has the batteries included, I have tried in different situations and it has behaved and complied perfectly, it is A must buy and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Juan C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit easy to use. Simple controls
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how I feel about this. Still debating on return. Simple to use and good quality. When measuring however I have an issue with this unit. When not attached to anything it would keep climbing ok DC readings. Should be reading zero however it would keep climbing into the 100’s. When touching wires it would read correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. Figured it was the batteries, so I changed them..but never worked. Cant speak to if others are like this.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: This meter is UNSAFE
customer_reviews.text: I have had this meter since late 2017, but haven't used it more than a couple of times. Yesterday, I put it to work measuring DC voltage, resistance and AC voltage. This meter is so jumpy and unstable. I can't trust it and am unwilling to risk my life on it. Looks like a real value, but what good is it if you can't trust or rely on it? I don't understand the high ratings or the "Amazon Best Choice" designation. I know how to use these devices and say, "Don't but it!".
customer_reviews.author: Fred In Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It's easy to use (it's a basic multimeter) Cheap Cons: The connections into the meter for the leads are terrible, loose, and wiggly Even with no leads connected it reads between 70-200mV DC... It doesn't give me faith that is very accurate, it also sucks for testing if voltage or present or not, because the meter is constantly fluctuating, so it could be at 120mV or 12.0V... Only way to know is to look at the tiny indicator.
customer_reviews.author: A K.

customer_reviews.title: First Impression>Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I’m no expert but great for what I needed. Comes with a ziplock case for tidy story, super sharp contacts and easy to follow instructions. No need to set a range on DC Volt measurement, it simply tells you what it reads. Tested first with a new 9 V battery and it read 9.1V. Then used it on my gate operator to test my 2 x 12V batteries with and without load. Read 23.9 V with gate closed and 23.4 as gate was opening. Confirmed my batteries are not my problem. First impression is that this is a great value product compared to my old one from Home Depot which is in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Betts

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I work as an electrician in the film industry and I use this meter probably at least once a week. Lots of guys use expensive brand name meters from big box stores but this is just as good and less than half as expensive. I don't regret it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Weidmann

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good quality for the price. It does what I want (measuring AC amperage). I was delighted to see it came with a zip-up case that holds the unit, test leads, and instructions. Although I can't vouch for its accuracy compared to other units, it appears to be well made and I'm getting consistent readings. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Barker

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value and performance!
customer_reviews.text: Easy-to-read display, simple to operate, quality leads, selector knob gives a satisfying click; comes with a carry strap and a handy soft case. I bought this to augment my Fluke meter and I couldn't be more pleased with it! The meter's quality and accuracy is top shelf! I easily recommend this as a high-quality back-up to a professional meter. Constant users: snag a padded cordura nylon or aluminum case for added protection; this meter is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: DeeJay Dude

customer_reviews.title: I use a multimeter for pretty basic stuff around the house like checking for power
customer_reviews.text: I use a multimeter for pretty basic stuff around the house like checking for power, checking batteries and using the bell for identifying wires through walls or whatever. I've gotten away with using cheapos from sears and recently an off brand from Amazon but they just aren't reliable. This is about 2x the price but so worth it. It repeats very well. With cheapos you get some weird readings too often and the read out is always fluctuating. Not with this one. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: robert quinn

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a meter to keep in the toolbag in the truck, and this indeed is a nice little meter for the price. Tested it against my Fluke and it was accurate (which made me happy!). Only drawback and the only reason I had to give 4 stars on accuracy was the display's refresh rate when measuring voltage and trying to track fluctuations in it. Otherwise it's a good solid little meter!
customer_reviews.author: Marino

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good value.
customer_reviews.text: Well built, simple to use, easy to carry. I tested it on several types of measurements, (including with a line splitter), and the readings were accurate. It's too early to know if it will continue to perform well long-term. But based on its construction, I think it will last a long time. I'm glad I bought it. I'd be remiss if I didn't repeat the advice of others: if you want to measure ac current, buy and use a line splitter with this device. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Works good but doesn't measure DC
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this so I could have a quality tester for my camper van, which uses 12v and 120. Mostly my need is 12v. When I realized my mistake, I went to return it. Customer service from Etekcity has been outstanding. They went ahead and sent me a new one with DC capabilities, no charge. Now that is customer service!!!! I would recommend any of their products based on their customer service alone.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W

customer_reviews.title: A big-time meter for a small-time price!
customer_reviews.text: The Etekcity MSR-C600 Digital Clamp Meter performs beyond my expectations. I also own a Fluke meter and compared readings between the two and this Etekcity provided almost identical readings. My reasoning for a second, less expensive, meter--- just that--- it's nicely priced, so if the situation is such that I might lose or damage this guy, it is not going to be a big deal to replace it. The case is included which was delightful after spending an extra $35 for a case for my other meter. This is a lot of meter for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Rick and CarolynTop Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The first unit worked fine, but after the Amazon return date...it failed. I had taken it down to Arizona and it was exposed indirectly to the hot weather. In the 100 to 109 degree range each day. Don't know if that caused the problem. I contacted Etekcity and after emailing them as proof of purchase and a picture of the unit they sent out a replacement. No charge and no hassle. New one works great.
customer_reviews.author: ScottinOregon

customer_reviews.title: I am going to order another one and see if I get the same result otherwise everything else look like it was
customer_reviews.text: Everything works except one setting which was the DC setting.When you would turn the selector switch on dc the screen would go blank. I am going to order another one and see if I get the same result otherwise everything else look like it was good
customer_reviews.author: crispy

customer_reviews.title: Even if I were a pro, this would be only meter I would need.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it works perfectly. I have a water heater element out as I suspected, and a dead battery in a vehicle that I didn't, it read more accurately on the DC setting than a $200 charger I have. Carry case is nice too, should keep it clean for a long time. Was surprised when the clamp jaw accurately read through two layers of insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Mav

customer_reviews.title: Did not work from first use
customer_reviews.text: I got a dud, turns on and looks fine until you try to read something with it.. Get 0 amps for all amperage tests. Flips out between random readings and "OL" on AC voltage tests. Unusable. Have had it for months before first use, so nonreturnable. Thought something as simple as a multimeter would work and would not have to be tested. Lucky I had a backup Harbor freight $5 multimeter. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Ely

customer_reviews.title: Pleased as much as I can be
customer_reviews.text: Just now opening meter that arrived today. Following along in the manual instructions are clear. The meter will do all I think I’ll need and go with my regular multi meter. Very please with what done so far.. I’m happy to see customer support phone number, email support and..drum roll please.. live chat. WONDERFUL. Everything about this purchase has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Brown

customer_reviews.title: A Meter to fill the bill!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this meter 5 stars because it came fast, worked perfectly, was packaged well and was just what I needed. I always wanted a clamp on meter but could never justify the cost. I generally regret buying tools that I think are priced too low because they lack build quality but I don’t think I will with this meter. It is substantial feeling, has an auto range and hold feature and is easy to operate. What else do you need.
customer_reviews.author: gecko

customer_reviews.title: Pleasently Surprised..... Bought a second unit.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted an inexpensive way to check parasitic low current drains in automotive work. Checked the accuracy against my Hewlett Packard insturments and right on the money at very low current values. This little unit does the job nicely. Bought a second one for the Electronics Bench.
customer_reviews.author: HDthumper

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Meter
customer_reviews.text: Great Value Meter, best part is its less complicated just toggle to desired setting and use. Design is also ergonomic very handy and you can toggle the setting nob using thumb. Has hold button to hold the value, based on the reading it also gives the max value recorded. It also comes with easy carry pouch. But yes u can't measure DC current / Amp in this, thats only the disappointment. Overall best multimeter with best value and quality
customer_reviews.author: Prashant

customer_reviews.title: Worth ever cent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome amp clamp. I work in a high volume automotive dealership and testing draws is a common situation now days with all the technology being slammed in vehicles. Tested the meter against my standard DVOM. This meter proved to be an accurate and efficient tool. I hope it holds up over time. My last amp clamp was 6 times the cost of this and lasted me for over 10 years. If i get a year or two out of the amp clamp I will call this purchase a success.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great deal !!
customer_reviews.text: Love this meter, has clamp or probes your choice depending on the task. So far it seems to be very accurate and super easy to use. Best part of this is Etekcity has the best customer service I've dealt with, they got a hold of me before the meter even arrived and followed up after. When they say 24/7 customer service, they mean it !!
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: No DC Amp Clamp Measurement
customer_reviews.text: This does not measure DC current with the clamp. In a couple of the pictures it shows no ~ next to the clamp measurement settings suggesting that it does DC and AC not just AC, and also they are clearly clamped onto a DC anderson connector cable in one of the pictures. It does however state AC in the advertisement, so I should have read it completely.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Brees

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for price, broke on 3rd month of use
customer_reviews.text: Lasted me 3 months, the clamp doesn't read accurately. It missed read most of the time, it was performing good the first month and slowly losing the feature's accuracy. Not safe to use anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Allen E.

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: I only use this as an amp meter and it functions perfectly for that. As others have expressed, when put on volts you get readings, i havent tested on volts because i have a serious multi meter i use for all multi meter function. Yes my multi does amps but it is not clip on and hence the only reason i purchased this meter. Am very happy with that functionality and give it 5 stars for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: T. Freese

customer_reviews.title: Told me what I needed to know
customer_reviews.text: My spa started tripping the circuit breaker and the first was that it was the heater. I replaced the heater only to find the breaker would still trip. I bought this handy meter and was able to check the current draw and found it was way below the meter rating. Thus, the meter turned out to be the problem, something that does not happen very often. Nice meter will keep it handy in my tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Etekcity MSR-C600 Digital Clamp Meter
customer_reviews.text: Auto range is great. IT IS NOT a DC amp clamp like it SHOWS in the pictures as advertisement. Shows ac on the amp clamp on both settings. Gave it to my son. He likes it... his first meter. I had purchased 2. Sent the second one back. Couldn't measure anything with it. Showing voltage when the leads were not even plugged into it. Don't think I would recommend one of these to my friend.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Ammeter feature did not work.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design of this little meter, and the reviews looked good. But the ammeter function simply did not work. Too good to be true I guess, since real Fluke ammeters cost close to $300. If you don't need this feature, the product is OK I guess, but I would buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Failed after two years
customer_reviews.text: I've had this multimeter about two years and have used it sparingly. It seemed to work fine when I did but now it's not working properly. The DC voltage is way off. On my car battery it reads a measurement that wouldn't start a car but my car starts without a problem. A much cheaper meter that I've had for years seems to take a much more accurate reading. It's a shame but that what happens when you don't get quality like Fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Manolo

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect resistance readings
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good meter BUT does not read resistance correctly. I work at a John Deere dealership and this caused me to chase my tail for a week. I got ahold of a friends fluke and it read correctly. I was trying to fix a problem that wasn’t there. Reads voltage fine. Other than that I do not trust the accuracy of this meter
customer_reviews.author: Zack Yarbro

customer_reviews.title: Measure yes, zip no
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever "tripped just before the finish line"? Everything seems fine, all bases are covered with this product, except the zipper on the bag. Upon opening, the bag's zipper was already off the zipper rails -- never got to zip it once. All the effort to make everything just right, then tripped at the finish line by including a faulty bag.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: I've used high end amp clamp meters before, notably Fluke. This meter does the same job for the average DIY homeowner. I used it to set up some electrical equipment around the house. The clamp works well, seems accurate enough compared to my other calibrated equipment. It probably won't last as long, the probes and case are definitely cheap, and it doesn't have all the options of higher end meters. Still very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Surprising value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with meter performance. Compared DC voltage reading with my Fluke multimeter and discovered only a 0.01 volt difference between meters when measuring 1.5 volt cells. Really like the compact size and auto-ranging functioning.
customer_reviews.author: photoguy1313

customer_reviews.title: Good meter for price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my father who mainly uses the Ammeter function in his electric motor repair business. He does like it. Accuracy is great, runs on inexpensive 2 AAA batteries. Plus the auto off function prevents dead batteries if you forget to turn off. This model will not measure DC amps, it's AC only for clamp. But it will measure DC volts.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Inexpensive Meter
customer_reviews.text: I have been using meter's for a very long time. For the price this one does the job well. I have not used the meter for measuring amps yet so can't comment on that but everything else works fine (AC and DC volts, ohms). Leads are thin and cheap but that's fine for my needs. If you are a professional, and use this meter all the time, you may want to replace with better ones.
customer_reviews.author: Big Chill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this multimeter to help diagnose an electrical problem am having with a vehicle. In my opinion, this meter is perfect for the DIY homeowner and/or shade tree mechanic. It's best feature is ease of use. Read the instructions and you'll be up and running in minutes. Comes with a case. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LewTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Works great, love the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is good fun! My old multimeter died so I decided to try a clamp one. I don't do enough electrical work to pay the money for the famous brand model. This works great, the leads show pretty accurate voltage on both 120 and 240 outlets. I also bought a line splitter and it shows pretty accurate amps on a high/low space heater.
customer_reviews.author: Steve_in_Austin

customer_reviews.title: Defected out of box
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get device to display measurements close to power source (AC, AA battery, DC adopters. I returned this unit and got another model. I may have received a defected unit
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive meter! Full feature!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an electrician and I use Fluke meters most all of the time but they are expensive and people love to steal them. I keep two of these, one in my glovebox and one in my laptop bag as a backup and honestly, they work just as well as the Flukes for 25% of the cost! Great meter!
customer_reviews.author: Sam jones

customer_reviews.title: Fine while it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this when I first got it, but after only 7 months of occasional use it just....died. Checked the batteries figuring they were cheap startup batteries, and they were full. I called the company at the number listed on their website and it's been disconnected. Update: I was able to contact the company using onlne chat and they responded immediately, sending a new unit out to replace mine. Despite the phone number issue, such customer service experience deserves to be recognized. I would not hesitate to buy their product again knowing how they stand behind it.
customer_reviews.author: John E. DeLappa

customer_reviews.title: Good basic meter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this meter for a birthday present for a friend of mine's son. It is a good meter to start out with. I was impressed that the meter has great basic functions ac\dc voltage range and can read up to 20 megohms of resistance, and check diodes. It does a lot for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pamella Lynn Homsher

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for basic electrical stuff
customer_reviews.text: I like the clamp option and the price, also the fact that all the functions I need are there. If I was building a fusion reactor in the basement I would pay the big bucks for the extreme range of abilities that the expensive models offer. The quality seems good, nothing cheesy that I can see and the moving parts work smoothly. I had a terrible ultra-cheap unit for years. This is a treat for my homeowner/tinkering/car maintenance uses.
customer_reviews.author: Carlgo

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I used this meter to measure the current in outdoor christmas decorations so as to not overload a light sequencer. I used a 1-foot 3-wire extension cord and stripped the outer coating so I could clamp on a single wire. Worked great. Also handy for a quick voltage measurement with the included leads. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B Johns

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a couple of uses
customer_reviews.text: Product read fine after first few uses. Then all the sudden started to get weird voltage and amp readings when drawing power. Voltage jumped to 16 volts. Then later was showing 24. Then eventually 50 volts and now is reading 80 volts. I have verified with a different volt meter and it shows a steady 12 volts as expected. Bought this for the amp meter and it also shows erroneous measurements. It's supposed to show 600mA, and it did on first 2 uses. Now is showing much lower around 100mA to 50mA. Verified with another expensive meter from work and that meter shows a steady 500-600mA draw.
customer_reviews.author: srg9832

customer_reviews.title: Works EXACTLY as it should, great bargain, but really could use a backlight & lead holder
customer_reviews.text: I've got a lot of mileage out of this thing over the past few months. The Ampere loop clamp also functions as a nice clip to hold it in weird places for household work. My only issues are that it'd be really nice to have a backlight and a lead holder. It has a nice case but this thing is durable enough, it doesn't really need it.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Noriega

customer_reviews.title: multimeter gave erratic readings in DC voltage range
customer_reviews.text: I returned this meter after a couple of days because it was giving erratic readings in the dc voltage range. I was measuring small amounts of dc voltage (mostly milliamps) and I doubted its accuracy. The amp reading and dc voltage reading was displaying constantly changing values EVEN WHEN IT WAS NOT IN A CIRCUIT and these values were ALL OVER THE PLACE.
customer_reviews.author: DogBoy

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Quality isn't excellent, but for the price I think its a good deal. I only use this around the house to check small things, and have gotten into the habit of checking-it-twice. While great for at home use, I would never consider it for work due to the amount of time you have to be on a component to get a reading. Also, the probe quality is....sub-par.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Good to Go
customer_reviews.text: I have a Fluke meter that doesn't have clamping. Working on my HVAC I needed to measure current so I purchased this one in hopes it would be close. To my surprise the quality was beyond expectations and the measurements were good in fact in comparisons with the Fluke all voltage and resistance readings were within 0.5%. In 35+ years my measurement and judgment have determined life safety of aircraft crews. I would not hesitate to by anything from this company. Wheels Up
customer_reviews.author: Ronald G.

customer_reviews.title: As good as any for home use...
customer_reviews.text: “Accuracy” is a mischaracterization, unless you’ve taken this to a test measurement diagnostic equipment test station, which I don’t think very many people have in their garage. Worked exceedingly well for my purposes of home handyman appliance repair.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Just like the Price is Right - it's a winner every time!
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply a great price for exactly what it says it will do. Not needed frequently for my house, but when I've needed it (to check fuses, etc) it's worked exactly as required. Simple and easy to use, it even came with a handy carrying case so I don't lose anything!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan W

customer_reviews.title: Shows readings without any contact
customer_reviews.text: I don't trust this device. Accuracy is highly questionable. It shows a reading without any contact, just by turning it on the LV reading will begin jumping up and down as of it picks up electricity of the air, too sensitive or just faulty. Also after you remove it from contact it'll never go down to zero as expected. Shows different readings on every contact. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great if you only measure AC current!
customer_reviews.text: Nifty item, love the way it feels in the hands. Cheap, works well, good multi-meter. However it doesn't measure DC current, so you'll have to pay more for one that does if you need it! But great for around the house if you only measure AC current.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Scary and inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: after the first month it now reads random voltage just being turned on...that could be scary! This clamp meter is now in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised how accurate it is. For the price. I wouldn't use on Amy industrial stuff. I normally use a fluke t600. But the retards have their voltage in whole numbers. No decimals. So for checking battery life on a car battery . Having no decimals is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Derk

customer_reviews.title: Great multimeter, very handy
customer_reviews.text: Got this multimeter to wire Ring retrofit kit. The manual is not really easy to read for me...maybe because I knew little about wiring and electronics before. But it works well to measure the resistances of zones from my old wired system.
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: I got it the same day... amazing! The device seems well built. Easy to use. I used it to test continuity to determine the power board in my dryer was bad. I'm sure I'll find many more uses. Handy device to have. Customer Support followed up shortly after purchase to see if there were any problems. Can't beat that...except maybe the price/value.
customer_reviews.author: Sniperboy360

customer_reviews.title: that it works
customer_reviews.text: when you turn the knob to DC why are there numbers flashing like a count down timer. my old multimeter just showed 00 until you put the prongs on a DC power source. the AC screen shows 00. I just got it and have not used it much, but it seams to work fine. I put in for the extended warr. IT is working very good.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: Wild readings when leads are not touching anything.
customer_reviews.text: When switching to dc voltage, the reading is all over the place, when the leads are not touching anything. Should read 0. However, the reading is pretty accurate when testing. It does come with a case and a strap, which is a big plus. I haven't tested the clamp yet. I will update later. Update: changing to 5 stars. it is accurate with measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Network guy

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage, Lasted 10 Minutes
customer_reviews.text: It's total junk, already in the trash.... I had it a few weeks. I used it 2 times for maybe like 20 seconds (not even 10 minutes) and was like "oh, very good"....but then I used it a 3rd time a few weeks later and once I set it to read DC voltage, it started at zero and just slowly climbed in mV--this is without any probes plugged in, it's just reading on it's own. I tried to take the cover off, but couldn't see any calibration. So, since I don't want to get electrocuted working on guitar amps, I threw it in the trash and was happy to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Spadaccini

customer_reviews.title: Cannot measure current
customer_reviews.text: This device cannot measure AC current in a 2 wire system. It only works, the rep told me, on a single wire. So it's useless to measure how much current an appliance draws, for example. I did not evaluate its other properties.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Do-It-Yourselfer Tool
customer_reviews.text: This Clamp Meter came in handy recently when I needed to repair my refrigerator that went out on me. I was able to use YouTube video instructions - as I am not an electrician - to diagnose my power problems on the fridge. The display was easy to read. The dials are clearly labeled. Good value!
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo E. Huezo

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be broken
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a chance to use this. Seemed to be working ok when purchased, but now, with new batteries installed, the display jumps and flickers and finally just goes blank. Very disappointed since it was rated high. I will try to get some help from the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Works well, cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Handy homeowner here. Everyone needs one of these. While I can't vouch for absolute precision of this unit, that's not why I bought it. I'll likely never use the leads, as I have a nice fluke I trust. The clamp feature is great to diagnose issues/shorts in devices. This helped diagnose an issue in my outdoor wood boiler.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust this cheap item, it wont last a month.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked that the item worked for less than 20 times. It startes showing voltage reading from the air even without the probes in place. It also hapend to start reading as it should 1 week later, but agai It began to malfuntioning few minutes later. Now it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says that it does. It is just fine for the non-professional, household user. I have not calibrated my device, but it appears to be accurate enough for the purpose for which I purchased it, it is pretty simple to use, and is worth what it costs.
customer_reviews.author: ExplEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Luck of the draw I guess. Mine doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and really wanted to like this. I needed a cheap replacement for my Fluke so I tried it. As others have said the measurements jump up and down. On DC voltage leads away from any metal or each other it shows .65-.75V. I just keep mine to remind myself not to buy cheap tools.
customer_reviews.author: No name listed

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work. Left it in the box until i wanted to use it. Put new batteries in it, no joy. Strange readings on the display, but not 120volts. Seemed like the perfect meter, especially the clamp on ammeter, but it doesn't work. No troubleshooting section in the instruction book. I'll just have to go back to using my $5 Italian analog voltmeter.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have only tested this unit and have not yet worked with it yet. First off, for the money you cannot go wrong. Secondly if you register your product on their website it extends the original warranty by a year. Double value right there.
customer_reviews.author: Biggie's Equipment

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a basic voltmeter to test batteries in my golf cart, and miscellaneous batteries for various items around the house. The only thing missing is protective covers for the leads, they are sharp! Other than that this works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed with the MSR-C600 it has a nice feel and quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the MSR-C600 it has a nice feel and quality. I received an electrical that was out of the norm so I ordered this unit to check the amps on my appliances. After checking a few I found that my bar fridge was running much longer and at 11 amps way to long and the amps are higher than should be after start up. time to junk it. I could have paid for a new one with the cost of the high utility bill. This meter has already paid for it's self.
customer_reviews.author: Michael George Schlitt

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Works accurately!
customer_reviews.text: 74 year old husband has fixed 2 problems with aging appliances & wiring in about an hour! It was great to see him so happy with a new spring in his step! He found it easy to use and so reasonably priced! Would recommend this to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Auto Shut Off Feature
customer_reviews.text: Great price, easy to read, works as advertised, automatically shuts off with a beep after about 10 minutes of non use (we’ve all left the DVM on before and drained the battery, right). Case might actually hold up for several years.
customer_reviews.author: B. W. Finger

customer_reviews.title: Comes with a case!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it works. This is my first ammeter/ dmm. I use flukes and agilents at work and they all have their own quirks. The price is the difference. I used this to measure my air conditioners current draw as I filled it with refrigerant.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: All Right
customer_reviews.text: This clamp works well, is well built, good materials, comes with a useful case, the functions are just the most required.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Amaya

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Seems built well. Nicr large display. a backlight would have been nice,. But not necessary. Comes with preinstalled batteries. Comes with storage bag and instructions. Leads can be removed. All functions seem to work well and accurately. This is my 1st meter so can't comment on ease of use compared to others. I'm still learning the ins and outs.
customer_reviews.author: SW2

customer_reviews.title: Barely works
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a couple weeks, trying to get it to work. It doesn't detect anything most of the time. The voltage numbers go up and down constantly without even touching anything. Occasionally, I can get it to read a battery or wall outlet with the leads, but usually the numbers are so over the place, I wouldn't stake my life on the reading being correct.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

product_meta.title: Etekcity Auto Ranging Clamp Meter, Digital Multimeter with Amp,Volt,Ohm,Diode and Resistance Test
product_meta.description: Etekcity's Digital Clamp Mustimeter ensures household electricity maintenance safe.
feature_bullets: Autoranging clamp multimeter measures AC currents, AC/DC voltage, resistance, and also provides diode and continuity tests
The clamp measures the AC current in a conductor up to 26mm without interrupting the circuit
Additional features include: Data Hold, Max Reading, and an easy-to-read large LCD
Comes with a handy carrying pouch, perfect for use while you're on the go
Automatically enters sleep mode after 15 minutes of inactivity for energy conservation; 1-year warranty and lifetime support from Etekcity

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,396 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
